subject: Re: [junit] Help plz...
msgSnippet: Hi jason, Glad to read ur reply mail. I had run the program the output is as follows: when assertEquals(2,langvect.length); the o/p is : $ java
messageBody:
Hi jason,
Glad to read ur reply mail.
I had run the program the output is as follows:

when assertEquals(2,langvect.length); the o/p is :
$ java TestLanguageVector

The size args.length =2
The size list.size() =3
List of Languages
TOMCAT
EJB
COBOL
value of langvect.length :2
Exception in thread "main" junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Exceptions
not handled. Say for add (null,null), etc
at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
at TestLanguageVector.testlangvect(TestLanguageVector.java:13)
at TestLanguageVector.main(TestLanguageVector.java:35)
=====================================================
When run using $ java junit.swingui.TestRunner TestLanguageVector
==================================================
Red color text in the GUI is :

Failed to invoke suite():java.lang.IllegalAccessException


when assertEquals(8,langvect.length); the o/p is :
====================================

$ java TestLanguageVector

The size args.length =2
The size list.size() =3
List of Languages
TOMCAT
EJB
COBOL
value of langvect.length :2
Exception in thread "main" junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected:<8>
but was:<2>
at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
at junit.framework.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:282)
at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:64)
at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:201)
at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:207)
at TestLanguageVector.testlangvect(TestLanguageVector.java:12)
at TestLanguageVector.main(TestLanguageVector.java:35)

=============================================

When run using $ java junit.swingui.TestRunner TestLanguageVector
==================================================
Red color text in the GUI is :

Failed to invoke suite():java.lang.IllegalAccessException


Regds
Chandu





On Tuesday 16 September 2003 8:33 pm, Jason Rogers wrote:
> Your suite() method is wrong. It should say:
>
> public static Test suite(){
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);
> return suite;
> }
>
> What exception is thrown when you give another index (other than 2)?
>
> =jason
>
> On Tue, 2003-09-16 at 06:22, Chan wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > Just go thro this program, it does not run for negative test
> > and how must the runtime bug must be fixed.
> >
> > Plz suggest me a solution.
> >
> > regards
> > chandu
> >
> > /* LanguageVector.java
> > */
> > /* Proram that stores that adds element in Vector
> > inserts a element at a specified position and displays */
> >
> > import java.util.*;
> > import java.io.*;
> > class LanguageVector
> > {
> > static Vector list = new Vector();
> > static int length;
> > public static void main(String args[])
> > {
> > length= args.length;
> > System.out.println("The size args.length ="+length);
> > for (int i=0; i<length ; i++)
> > {
> > list.addElement(args[i]);
> > }
> > list.insertElementAt("COBOL",2);
> > int size= list.size();
> > System.out.println("The size list.size() ="+size);
> > String listArray[]=new String[size];
> > list.copyInto(listArray);
> > System.out.println("List of Languages");
> > for (int i=0; i<size ; i++)
> > {
> > System.out.println(listArray[i]);
> > }
> >
> > }
> > }
> >
> >
> >
> > /* Test Program TestLanguageVector.java*/
> > /* This programs fails when i run a negative test. Plz go thro the
> > comments i have typed */
> >
> >
> > import junit.framework.*;
> > import java.util.*;
> > import java.io.*;
> > class TestLanguageVector extends TestCase {
> > LanguageVector langvect =new LanguageVector();
> > public void testlangvect(){
> > System.out.println("value of langvect.length"+langvect.length);
> > assertEquals(2,langvect.length);
> > /* the assert fails when i give other value than 2, and the program
> > throws exception and stops, the next assertion is not tested and no
> > FALIURE mssg is given.*/
> > assertEquals("COBOL",langvect.list.elementAt(2));
> > }
> >
> > public static Test suite(){
> > return new TestSuite("TestLanguageVector.class");
> > }
> >
> >
> > public static void main(String args[])
> > {
> >
> > String params[] = {"TOMCAT","EJB"};
> > /*I passs parameters to the main () of LanguageVector.java */
> > LanguageVector.main(params);
> > /*1.If the below two stmts are not added the testlangvect() is not
> > getting innitaited */
> > /*2. If I run negative test the Faliure msg is not displayed
> > the program stops after throwing the first Exception */
> >
> > TestLanguageVector testlangVector= new TestLanguageVector();
> > testlangVector.testlangvect();
> >
> > junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
> > System.out.println("Test Stmt");
> > }
> > }
> >
> >
> >
